description: The manifest expected to exist at /flywheel/v0/manifest.json in a gear image.
title: Flywheel Gear Manifest

_88uriOrEmpty.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

___cite.description: (optional) Any citations relevant to the algorithm(s) or work present in the gear.

___license.description: The name of the license that applies to this gear. Must be an OSI-approved SPDX license string or 'Other'. Ref: https://spdx.org/licenses Example: apache-2.0

___config.description: Schema snippets describing the options this gear consumes. Not currently processed.

___custom.description: A place for gear authors to put arbitrary information.

___environment.description: Environment variables that should be set for the gear.

___label.description: The human-friendly name of this gear.

$eref.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

___source.description: The URL where the source code of this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.

___flywheel.description: A currently-unused key. Ignored if present.

___description.description: A brief description of the gear's purpose. Ideally 1-4 sentences.

___version.description: A human-friendly string explaining the release version of this gear. Example: 3.2.1

$eref.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

___url.description: The URL where more information about this gear can be found. Leave blank if none.

___maintainer.description: (optional) The maintainer of this gear. Can be used to distinguish the algorithm author from the gear maintainer.

___command.description: If provided, the starting command for the gear, rather than /flywheel/v0/run. Will be templated according to the spec.

___capabilities.description: A set of features the gear requires to run (for example, networking).

___inputs.description: Schema snippets describing the inputs this gear consumes.

anyOf.description: A file input, optionally using schema snippets to further refine the type of file taken.

___optional.description: Allow the gear to mark an input file as optional.

___description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

anyOf.description: A contextual input, retrieved from the environment on launch.

___description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

anyOf.description: An api-key input for accessing data with an SDK.

___description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

___read-only.description: Requests that the provisioned API key be only allowed read access.
